meanings.definition: A type of flour made from ground parched corn.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for pinoles to be used as a key ingredient in the cornbread.
meanings.sent2: She bought a bag of pinoles to make traditional corn tortillas.
meanings.sent3: The pinoles in the pantry were so tempting that she ended up baking corn muffins at midnight.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen, reminding her of the comforting scent of pinoles.
meanings.sent5: As she sifted the pinoles, the fine texture reminded her of soft sand on a sunny beach.

meanings.definition: A type of food made from parched corn kernels.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed snacking on pinoles during their picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: The market sold various flavors of pinoles, from spicy to sweet.
meanings.sent3: She playfully tossed a handful of pinoles in the air, pretending they were confetti.
meanings.sent4: The crunch of the pinoles echoed through the room, like tiny applause for the chef.
meanings.sent5: The colorful packaging of the pinoles caught her eye, promising a tasty treat inside.

meanings.definition: A type of snack made from parched corn.
meanings.sent1: During the movie night, they shared a big bowl of pinoles, passing it around the room.
meanings.sent2: The vendors at the fair offered freshly popped pinoles as a popular snack.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly juggled the pinoles, pretending they were popcorn kernels.
meanings.sent4: The sound of laughter mixed with the crunch of pinoles, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The pinoles were so addictive that she found herself reaching for more after each handful.
